conclusion: Determine the angle between the velocity of the slider and the horizontal direction when it lands at point C.
The slider is ejected from the spring with a speed v_B.
The slider moves horizontally from B to C and then follows a projectile motion after leaving the platform.
The horizontal distance between B and C is x_{BC} = 0.9 m.
The vertical drop from the platform to the ground is h = 0.53 m.
Calculate the time of flight using the equation for free fall: t = sqrt(2h/g).
Using g = 9.8 m/s^2, find t = sqrt(2 * 0.53 / 9.8) ≈ 0.33 s.
Calculate the horizontal velocity component v_x: v_x = x_{BC} / t = 0.9 / 0.33 ≈ 2.73 m/s.
Calculate the vertical velocity component at landing v_y: v_y = g * t = 9.8 * 0.33 ≈ 3.23 m/s.
Determine the angle of landing using the tangent function: tan θ = v_y / v_x = 3.23 / 2.73.
The angle between the velocity and the horizontal direction when the slider lands at point C is approximately 49.4°.
